meanings.definition: Having an extremely high level of insulation to reduce heat loss or gain.
meanings.sent1: The superinsulated house stayed warm even during the coldest winter days.
meanings.sent2: The superinsulated walls kept the heat inside, saving energy and money.
meanings.sent3: The penguins in their superinsulated igloo were the envy of the Antarctic.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a superinsulated room, keeping her thoughts private and secure.
meanings.sent5: The superinsulated jacket was like a cozy hug on a chilly evening.

meanings.definition: To insulate (a building) to an extremely high level to reduce energy consumption.
meanings.sent1: They decided to superinsulate their attic to lower their heating bills.
meanings.sent2: The company plans to superinsulate their office building next month.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels superinsulated their treehouse to stay warm in winter.
meanings.sent4: She superinsulated her heart against further emotional pain.
meanings.sent5: The chef superinsulated the oven to ensure even baking of the cake.
